data.title: Tyler ETECS/ARC Weekly Lunch
data.text: Our ETECS amateur radio group usually meets each week at Don Juan's On The Square, for Mexican Food, but Tuesday's Weekly Special at Rick's On The Square is Meatloaf and two sides. Today, someone in the group, wanted meatloaf.  Excellent choice!  Large portions and a great selection of sides!  I had the meatloaf, with gratin potatoes and green beans.  Iced tea and tax brought the bill up to just over $13.  The tomato sauce on the meatloaf was a little sweet, but everything was perfectly cooked and the service was quick and exceptional!  This was the second time I have eaten at Rick's and I was not disappointed either time.  Rick's is a great place for lunch or dinner, with a very extensive menu and reasonable prices.

data.title: Ruined my Rehearsal Dinner
data.text: I had a fabulous Rehearsal Dinner planned at Rick's, and my husband's family spent a pretty penny to have the top floor, flowers, candles, videographer, etc. Rick's had a band start playing under us that was EXTREMELY loud, and my sister in law talked to the owners and employees downstairs multiple times to turn it down. They did NOTHING and allowed drunk people to go upstairs and yell during meaningful speeches. They had two bar fights downstairs that almost knocked me down and almost hit someone in our wedding party. They did not care for the most important weekend in my life, and they did NOTHING to make up for it. For this, I have told every person I know in Tyler to never go back or to have a rehearsal dinner there. My sister had a much better experience with her rehearsal dinner the year before, it is unfortunate they could not do it again. Never will go back.

data.title: I always like going to Rick's!
data.text: The menu here is solid and tasty and the atmosphere and service are always really good. I would like to go more to hear the music but it tends to start a little late.

data.title: Not bad, but didn't compare to other local options
data.text:
Rick's should be called "Mix" -- it does well in some areas, but falls short in others.
The location on the square is great.  Accessible and in an interesting part of town.  The layout is spacious -- you are not elbow-to-elbow with other patrons.  Service was good.  Food was tasty -- you could tell the chef was experienced and made the effort to provide you with a good meal, well-presented.  Compared to FD's, it was very overpriced and not as sumptuous.  We started with the fried calamari.  It was overbreaded, seemed to be something fried out of a bag -- not house-made -- and was piled high -- on a big bed of lettuce.  Turns out it was a lettuce plate with some calamari.  Fortunately, it was not that tasty, so we really didn't miss having more.  Interestingly, they offer "Ranch dressing, tartar sauce, or cocktail sauce" -- another indicator it is something pre-packaged, not made on site.  I do NOT recommend the calamari.  As for entrees, we both opted for the specials.  My wife had the Sirloin topped with crab and I had the Mahi.  She could not finish her meal and I was left a tad hungry.  Her steak was cooked to perfection and my mahi was a shade undercooked and not particularly savory.  The accompanying rice made up for it, though -- a uniquely concocted blend of spices and fflavors.  

As an aside, we are foodies and music lovers, but, for the first time my life, I almost had to ask the server to have the manager change the music.  After the third consecutive song about "I just wanna sex you" or "Ride my thaaang", I looked around at other families eating there and actually said to my wife, "If one more of these songs comes on, I will call for the manager."  It didn't, so I didn't.  Marvin Gaye and Otis Redding saved the day.  Still, if you have a family eatery and cater to a wide range of customers, there is no need to go so "urban" -- actually so base.  

We had read the reviews, noted the high ranking, and looked forward to stopping at Ricks.  We left feeling it was overpriced and overrated.  There are far better options around town.

data.title: Best Place for a Real Lunch
data.text: Rick's has wonderful food, a wide variety of specials, spirits and excellent service.  They know how to get it all to you hot.

data.title: Love this place
data.text: This place has great food and a good atmosphere. The inside is wonderful for fine dining and date night. My company also had our Christmas party there and it was an excellent experience. The patio and bar area are hopping on Friday and Saturday night with live music and dancing. The drinks are good and the fun times are abundant. There is an upstairs area for events. My high school had our 10 year reunion up there and the food was catered and set up buffet style with tables and a full bar. We had a lovely dinner and then went downstairs to the patio and danced the night away.

data.title: Good live music and drinks
data.text:
I have been to Rick's on the Square twice.  I have not eaten here, but I've listened to bands and have had drinks on the patio while hanging with friends.    it's a great place for both.

The patio is a great place to have drinks and talk with friends.   It's relaxing.  Fans are every where and the wait staff is friendly.   This is a great place to relax and unwind

data.title: Food was amazing!
data.text: We had lunch at Ricks today!  Spinach salad, salmon, grilled shrimp were amazing.  Didn't like Mac n cheese.  Not a kids place!

data.title: Excellent lunch salad
data.text: I ordered the taco salad but substituted chicken for ground beef.  It was excellent. Service was very good and the atmosphere was conducive to a good business lunch. My lunch partner had a plate where you mix and match veggies & meats.  He is a regular and varies his lunch to fit his diet.

data.title: Great atmosphere
data.text: While downtown, this is a great place to sit and unwind.  Good food and atmosphere.  Very popular in the evening.

data.title: Diverse Menu, Neat Layout!
data.text:
Went for a night out to Rick's and had a great time. We stayed for about 4.5 hours! Started with dinner and we were very pleased. Huge variety on the menu. I had the crawfish stuffed fillet as featured on the Food Network.  Cooked perfectly medium rare just as I ordered with side of au grautin potatoes. Excellent food!
After dinner, we grabbed a cigar and went out on the porch for a smoke and a drink. The staff were nice enough to keep our table reserved for us since we wanted to come back and watch the band. 
The Good Question Band kicked off around 8:30pm and were absolutely amazing. Awesome mix of music from 70s through today's hits. One of the best live cover bands I've ever seen! 
All in all, Rick's was a great experience and I would definitely recommend. Try to pick a night when the GQ Band will be there! You won't be disappointed!

data.title: Happy Hour turned dinner
data.text:
Jury duty let out late so the husband and I met at Rick's for a quick martini... Which never stays just one martini. The bartenders were courteous and nice, the olives weren't soggy and homemade potato chips were crisp and salty. 
So, we decided to mosey on over to the dining room for supper. Taco salad had perfectly seasoned beef and crisp tortilla strips on top. I ordered the Cobb and was not disappointed. Only one hard boiled egg... But I love eggs so I'm sure according to "real foodies" this would suffice. 
No dessert was had, unless you count cocktails.

data.title: A genuinely wonderful experience!
data.text: My wife and I went on a beautiful Saturday night for our Anniversary and found the entire experience to be perfect. Everything from the dinner which included and I highly recommend, crawfish stuffed filets, gulf oysters and white chocolate bread pudding to the perfect ambiance of the patio's live music set, The staff was well informed and versed in the dishes so don't be afraid to ask for a recommendation, just make sure you trust them and try it. Make a reservation, order a few of their amazing drinks (personally loved the Crown Royal Martini) and enjoy a little live music downtown.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: Good service, nice atmosphere, big portions. Food was just average, on salty side. I was nice to try but not good enough to come back.

data.title: Expensive Evening
data.text:
This was an expensive evening for entrees that were substandard. We ordered the Salmon A1 Ajillo and the Red Snapper A1 Ajillo. Our fish portions were so saturated with sherry there was no taste of the fish at all. It was extremely overpowering.

The dining room looked unappealing and dark. The tables were stained so they appeared as if they were not cleaned.

Very disappointed!

data.title: Amazing lunch
data.text: This is the place to go for lunch. I've been twice recently and both times the food was great. Everyday they have a different lunch special. On Wednesday they have Gigi's choice and on the one I was there it was beef tips with mushrooms and rice. It was fantastic. I ended up back there on Friday and on Friday its catfish. I truly believe it was the best catfish I've ever eaten. All of that and this is just the lunch review!!

data.title: Great food and atmosphere!
data.text: The food and drinks were wonderful!  The atmosphere and service was great too!  Will be coming back for more!

data.title: Used to be a great live music venue
data.text:
This was once the go to for live music.  I've heard from band members that the owner is hard to deal with so many of the acts that used to play there simply wont come back.  Its disappointing.  

The food is good.  Drinks are expensive.

data.title: Good food...nice architecture!!!!
data.text: Loved the ambiance of the old downtown feel of this place....food was good, but falls more along the line of average when compared to all the other local downtown joints.  I'd go back, but will visit other places, as well!

data.title: Live music!
data.text: New to Tyler and wanted to take a night out. I drove by Ricks while getting to know downtown. Turns out this night they had a band planning and it was so much FUN! When you walk in, there is a big dining room on the left. The bar is straight as you walk in and the stage with the band playing is through a doorway on the right. Loved that when you walk in to see the band you are on the balcony and the band is below you. And if you look up you will see the sky/stars since the roof is open! The band was so much fun...the saxophone and trombone guys walked and danced throughout the the crowd while playing. Really fun night and we will come back.
